content: simnia cardigan ~ 1 ~ simnia cardigan by jan cullen simnia cardigan is a traditional yoke style with a flared skirt the patterning on the skirt is reminiscent of sea shells it is a repeat of six stitches and is easy to memorise the sleeve and skirt lengths may be adjusted if desired the cardigan is worked from the top down seamlessly initially you will be working flat in row from the neckband to the sleeve separation sleeve stitches are put on hold while you finish the skirt then the sleeve stitches are returned to the needles circular or dpn s and worked seamlessly to the cuff there are optional short row to add shaping to the back of the yoke the button bands are knitted with the rest of the garment in one piece the sample above is shown in lavanda by colour adventures © janet cullen 2013 simnia cardigan ~ 2 ~ age to fit chest size yarn required approximate cm inch meters yards 0-3 months 40 5 16 295 320 3-9 months 46 18 410 450 6-12 months 51 20 455 500 this design has about 5 cm/2 inches of positive ease and is meant to be worn over a babies other garments suggested yarns gauge 22 sts x 28 row = 10 cm/4 inches dia twist dk by colour adventures over stockinette stitch on 4 mm/us 6 needles 100% merino 229m/250yds in 115g/4 06oz or size required to meet gauge dia sport by colour adventures 100% merino 251m/274yds in 100g/3 53oz useful techniques 100% extra fine merino 10/28nm dk weight by colourmart cast on methods 100% merino 421m/460yds in 150g/5 29oz knittinghelp com/videos/cast-on notions blocking knitty com/issuewinter02/featdiyknitter html 4 mm us 6 needles circular or dpns for sleeves short row 3 25 mm us 3 needles circular or dpns for techknitting blogspot co uk/2009/10/short- sleeves row-method html stitch holders or scrap yarn 4 stitch markers 4 or more buttons -
